{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{inet6__address_8h_acd1b19c7b94eb7d2cedc3a5c4a3c588e} 
bool sockpp\+::operator!= (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{const in6\+\_\+addr \&}]{lhs}{, }\item[{const in6\+\_\+addr \&}]{rhs}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}



Test if two low-\/level C IPv6 addresses are different. 


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em lhs} & An IPv6 address \\
\hline
{\em rhs} & An IPv6 address \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
{\itshape true} if the addresses are different, {\itshape false} if they match. 
\end{DoxyReturn}

\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{operator$<$$<$()}{operator<<()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{inet6__address_8h_a07e6a852b6aac41fcb6ea9660c4811dd} 
std\+::ostream \& sockpp\+::operator$<$$<$ (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{std\+::ostream \&}]{os}{, }\item[{const \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1inet6__address}{inet6\+\_\+address}} \&}]{addr}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Stream inserter for the address. 

This uses the simple dot notation of the address as returned from inet\+\_\+ntop(). It does not attempt a host lookup. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em os} & The output stream \\
\hline
{\em addr} & The address \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
A reference to the output stream. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
